content: Google's Nest Audio is a great speaker, and the data proves it. I really enjoy how it sounds and performs.
The Google's Nest Audio is a great speaker. It's impressive, even considering the price, and the sound is great.
The Google Nest Thermostat is not compatible with the Nest App. This is frustrating and makes integration difficult.
Looks like Google is releasing a new Nest Wifi device very soon, I'm excited to see the new features.
The Nest Hub functionality is very nice to have and it has become a valuable tool in my smart home setup.
Google Nest Audio, Mini, and Home Mini get updated lights with Gemini. It's a great addition to those products.
Google Nest Audio Speaker Review: The base is well separated and strong and, the high-pitched sound is more vivid.
The Google Nest Audio is a great smart speaker it has plenty of tricks up its sleeve for the user.
The Google Nest Audio is a great smart speaker with plenty of tricks. Google dropped the old aesthetic for a cleaner look.
Yes I am using Google Home mini in India, well it's a different world of audio experience with the google search embedded into it.
Nest Audio is great for music the sound quality is excellent for the price. It is not designed for video do not even try it.
My record player setup with Google Home Max is trash. The sound quality is amazing when it works, but it's too glitchy.
I don't know about watching TV with them, but the Google Mini sounds great. I imagine the upgraded sound is awesome!
I use Apple TV with Nest Max pair, and it works well, with better bass than the TVâ€™s speakers.
Our Nest Audio stopped working after we came home from vacation. Support wouldn't help because it's out of warranty.
Sound quality is in the ears of the beholder, music chosen, and room played in, so wait for more sound tests.
Even the Nest Mini or the Nest Hub 2 are upgrades to Home Mini because they both offer a richer sound.
I have both, but I prefer the Max as I can use the Aux for gaming/live-tv etc. latency-free, so its a win!
Nest 3rd Gen thermostat is super amazing. The router reviews for nest have said to stay away from that product.
Reviews indicate the same thing: these have really good sound. It has good speakers and the data to prove it.
One 2" Google Home vs one 3 3/4" tweeter on the Nest Audio. Compare Google Home Max to Nest Audio next.
These would be great as bookshelf speakers. They'd have a place in my home and work as the sound for the TV.
If the difference is only $20, get the Nest Audio. It has faster processors and better sound, so its worth it.
The new nest audio in our front room is not all that different in sound from my other google homes.
